content:
• Tuesday, January 3, 2012
  • AMRN

    Biopharmaceutical developer Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) dips in after-hours trading after announcing...

    Biopharmaceutical developer Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) dips in after-hours trading after announcing its wholly owned Irish subsidiary, Corsicanto Limited, has commenced a $150M debt offering of exchangeable senior notes due 2032. Shares -8.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:22 PM
  • BMTI

    BioMimetic Therapeutics (NASDAQ:BMTI) tanks in the post-trading session after the FDA says its...

    BioMimetic Therapeutics (NASDAQ:BMTI) tanks in the post-trading session after the FDA says its proposed bone-graft device, Augment, wouldn't be approved without more information from previous studies. The company says it plans to submit the necessary information by the middle of the year. Shares -10.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:13 PM
  • LNDC

    Landec (NASDAQ:LNDC) beat FQ2 expectations on a 63% Y/Y jump in profit, as the packaging...

    Landec (NASDAQ:LNDC) beat FQ2 expectations on a 63% Y/Y jump in profit, as the packaging company's Apio food-products business benefited from higher volume and solid export growth. Shares +4.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:44 PM
  • TISI

    Team Inc. (NASDAQ:TISI) FQ2 beats across-the-board as earnings rose 28% Y/Y on double-digit...

    Team Inc. (NASDAQ:TISI) FQ2 beats across-the-board as earnings rose 28% Y/Y on double-digit revenue growth across its major geographic markets. The company also raises its FY12 EPS estimate to $1.55 - $1.70, and its revenue view to $585 - $610M. Shares +3.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • NATI

    National Instruments (NASDAQ:NATI) says it expects its Q4 revenue to miss expectations, citing a...

    National Instruments (NASDAQ:NATI) says it expects its Q4 revenue to miss expectations, citing a slowdown in revenue growth in Europe. It now says revenue will be around $277M, below its October estimate of $282 - $302M. Shares -6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM
  • TIVO

    TiVo (NASDAQ:TIVO) jumps 14.9% AH after AT&T (T +0.2% AH) agrees to pay about $215M to...

    TiVo (NASDAQ:TIVO) jumps 14.9% AH after AT&T (T +0.2% AH) agrees to pay about $215M to settle a patent lawsuit - about $51M up front and regular payments through 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM
  • APKT

    Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT) resumes trading after cutting guidance. Shares -20% AH.

    Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT) resumes trading after cutting guidance. Shares -20% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • APKT

    Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT) lowers guidance, seeing 2011 revenue of $308M-$310M against consensus...

    Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT) lowers guidance, seeing 2011 revenue of $308M-$310M against consensus of $318M. EPS are lowered to $1.03-$1.05 against consensus of $1.14. "Our results were impacted by uncertainty in the North American service provider market," says CEO Andy Ory. Shares to resume trading momentarily. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • PRGS

    Progress Software (NASDAQ:PRGS) beats Q4 estimates, reporting an EPS of $0.34 on revenue of...

    Progress Software (NASDAQ:PRGS) beats Q4 estimates, reporting an EPS of $0.34 on revenue of $136M. The company lowers guidance for FQ1 however, now seeing an EPS of $0.25 on revenue of $120M, below consensus EPS expectations of $0.38 on $132M in revenue. Shares -6.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • VTR

    Ventas (NYSE:VTR) announces the sale of 21M shares by Lazard Real Estate Partners, LLC in a...

    Ventas (NYSE:VTR) announces the sale of 21M shares by Lazard Real Estate Partners, LLC in a public offering to be underwritten by Citigroup. Shares off 2.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • KODK

    Eastman Kodak (EK) is told by the NYSE it has six months to get back into compliance or risk...

    Eastman Kodak (EK) is told by the NYSE it has six months to get back into compliance or risk de-listing because its stock has traded below $1 the last 30 trading days. To restore compliance, EK shares would have to trade at $1 on the closing day of one of those six months, and at $1 on average over the 30 days leading up to the close. EK -2.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • MBI

    MBIA (MBI +8.1%) soars into the close after a judge in its case against Bank of America's...

    MBIA (MBI +8.1%) soars into the close after a judge in its case against Bank of America's (NYSE:BAC) Countrywide unit rules the insurer only has to prove Countrywide made misrepresentations about the loans in MBS it sold, rather than proving a "direct causal link" to losses. Shares up another 3.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 14 Comments
  • APKT

    Trading on Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT) is halted pending a news announcement after shares were up...

    Trading on Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT) is halted pending a news announcement after shares were up 3% on the day and off 0.1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • MJN

    In light of the all-clear for Enfamil in the bacteria case that sent Mead Johnson (MJN +3.8%)...

    In light of the all-clear for Enfamil in the bacteria case that sent Mead Johnson (MJN +3.8%) shares tumbling, William Blair says the stock is at "a level we view as attractive in light of the company's attractive long-term growth and return characteristics," based on penetration and consumption growth opportunities in emerging markets and a potential recovery in the U.S. birthrate over time.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • NED

    Noah Education (NED +2.3%) trades higher after saying earlier that its CEO, Jerry He, resigned...

    Noah Education (NED +2.3%) trades higher after saying earlier that its CEO, Jerry He, resigned for personal reasons on Sunday, after taking the job just nine months ago.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • MU

    Micron (MU +7.6%) looks "extremely cheap," Barclays says in raising its stock rating to...

    Micron (MU +7.6%) looks "extremely cheap," Barclays says in raising its stock rating to Overweight, believing that expected PC headwinds in 2012 are already priced into shares. Shares are also driven by a report that one its biggest competitors, Elpida Memory, may merge with Toshiba, which would be a sign of consolidation in an industry hurt by cutthroat competition. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO +12.4%) soars even higher as Credit Suisse's Kulbinder Garcha reinstates coverage...

    Fusion-io (FIO +12.4%) soars even higher as Credit Suisse's Kulbinder Garcha reinstates coverage with an Outperform and a price target of $50. Garcha believes the ability of the company's technology to allow customers to cut costs is greater than the street realizes and sees revenues for 2012 coming in ahead of current estimates. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • HOLX

    Hologic (HOLX +2.2%) moves up after Morgan Stanley raises the stock to Overweight on valuation,...

    Hologic (HOLX +2.2%) moves up after Morgan Stanley raises the stock to Overweight on valuation, citing an improved outlook for its Tomosynthesis mammography technology.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • ZUMZ

    Zumiez (ZUMZ -4.1%) takes a hit after Piper Jaffray cut the shares to Neutral on valuation,...

    Zumiez (ZUMZ -4.1%) takes a hit after Piper Jaffray cut the shares to Neutral on valuation, noting that the teen-apparel retailer's comps are likely to become more challenging over the next several months.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • STJ

    Collins Stewart says St. Jude Medical (STJ +2.2%) generally outperforms in the first six weeks...

    Collins Stewart says St. Jude Medical (STJ +2.2%) generally outperforms in the first six weeks of the year, and should rise 20% in 2012. The firm notes share price was volatile last year because of a slowdown in the market for heart rhythm devices and a weak euro, plus a delay in the regulatory approval of a key product.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • ONXX

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (ONXX -2.2%) dips after Jefferies cut the shares to Hold from Buy, citing...

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (ONXX -2.2%) dips after Jefferies cut the shares to Hold from Buy, citing limited upside potential from the company's upcoming drug trials.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +4.4%) shares march higher after SunTrust says its channel checks...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +4.4%) shares march higher after SunTrust says its channel checks show sales of K-cups and Keurig machines were extremely strong over the holidays, which should help dissipate recent concerns on inventory levels and brewer sell-through. The firm also sees better-than-expected Q1 earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM | 7 Comments
  • SCHL

    Scholastic (SCHL +3.3%) acquires Learners Publishing, a Singapore-based English language...

    Scholastic (SCHL +3.3%) acquires Learners Publishing, a Singapore-based English language learning supplemental publisher, for an undisclosed sum. The acquisition is expected to significantly enhance the company's portfolio of products in the English Language Learning segment.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • NAV

    Navistar (NAV +0.6%) moves up despite an earlier downgrade to Underweight by JP Morgan. The firm...

    Navistar (NAV +0.6%) moves up despite an earlier downgrade to Underweight by JP Morgan. The firm has been a consistent skeptic on truck builder, noting it still thinks FY estimates "are too high and that expectations will once again have to be revised downward." It also says the stock could take a hit if the company actually pursues a merger with rival Oshkosh (NYSE:OSK) that's being pushed by Carl Icahn.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • YZC

    Yanzhou Coal Mining (YZC +5%) pops after being upgraded to Overweight from Equalweight on...

    Yanzhou Coal Mining (YZC +5%) pops after being upgraded to Overweight from Equalweight on valuation at Barclays.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • ANGI

    Shares of Angie's List (ANGI -5.4%) slide after a slew of analysts pick up coverage on the...

    Shares of Angie's List (ANGI -5.4%) slide after a slew of analysts pick up coverage on the company. Janney initiates coverage at Buy with a $19 price target, but three other major firms start with Sector Perform or their equivalents - not too impressive, Eric Savitz writes, "given the Street’s tendency to stay bullish on their own merchandise."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM | 7 Comments
  • TGA

    TransGlobe Energy (TGA +4.3%) closes on its West Bakr acquisition in Egypt from Egyptian...

    TransGlobe Energy (TGA +4.3%) closes on its West Bakr acquisition in Egypt from Egyptian Petroleum Development in a $60M all-cash deal. The purchase gives the company operating rights to three fields with 28 producing wells, with an average productions of 4,350 barrels of oil per day.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • WOR

    Worthington (WOR +3.5%) acquires Angus Industries, a designer and manufacturer of...

    Worthington (WOR +3.5%) acquires Angus Industries, a designer and manufacturer of custom-engineered cabs and operator stations for heavy mobile equipment, for $180M in cash. The company will operate as Engineered Cabs, a Worthington stand-alone business segment.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • SODA

    Sodastream (SODA +5.1%) rallies after Monness, Crespi, Hardt & Co.'s Jim Chartier tells clients...

    Sodastream (SODA +5.1%) rallies after Monness, Crespi, Hardt & Co.'s Jim Chartier tells clients that channel checks indicate "widespread stockouts" of the firm's carbonation systems. The analyst keeps a Buy rating and lofty $70 price target on shares firmly in place.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • KND

    Shares of Kindred Healthcare (KND -7.1%) fall after the company receives a negative mention in...

    Shares of Kindred Healthcare (KND -7.1%) fall after the company receives a negative mention in Citi's gloomy report on hospital companies and catches a downgrade from Bank of America to Underperform.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • ATHOF

    Athabasca Oil Sands (OTCPK:ATHOF) exercises its option to sell its 40% stake in the MacKay River...

    Athabasca Oil Sands (OTCPK:ATHOF) exercises its option to sell its 40% stake in the MacKay River oil-sands project in Alberta to joint owner PetroChina (PTR +4.9%) for C$680M ($669M). The transaction comes less than a week after regulators approved the planned 150,000-barrel-a-day project. (PR .pdf)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • NTR

    Potash (POT +4.9%) moves up after Susquehanna raises its rating on the shares to Positive on...

    Potash (POT +4.9%) moves up after Susquehanna raises its rating on the shares to Positive on valuation, citing expectations for an increase in domestic corn acreage planting.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM

  • Spanish 10-year bond yields jump 18 bps to 5.29% as traders cash in on debt that they say looks...

    Spanish 10-year bond yields jump 18 bps to 5.29% as traders cash in on debt that they say looks expensive vs. that of Italy. In addition, the grim outlook for Spain's public finances is starting to affect its outperformance over Italy, whose yields rise slightly to 6.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • THC

    Citigroup sends hospital stocks lower with an in-depth report in which it downgrades eight firms...

    Citigroup sends hospital stocks lower with an in-depth report in which it downgrades eight firms in the sector and provides a gloomy forecast for government health-care spending. THC -2.73%, SUNH -1.03%, LNCR -2.94%, AHS -5.6%, HCA -1.7%, HMA -1.9%, LPNT -1.88%, and UHS -2.75%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • GCI

    Gannett (NYSE:GCI) climbs 4.3%, perhaps benefiting from the general happy mood but also possibly...

    Gannett (NYSE:GCI) climbs 4.3%, perhaps benefiting from the general happy mood but also possibly gaining because of USA Today's app making its debut on Amazon's Kindle Fire, meaning that it is now available on all major platforms and devices. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • PCAR

    Paccar (PCAR +3.7%) moves higher despite JP Morgan downgrading the shares to Neutral earlier...

    Paccar (PCAR +3.7%) moves higher despite JP Morgan downgrading the shares to Neutral earlier today, citing weakening fundamentals and concern over the company's exposure to the European truck market if the region slips into a recession.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • TEX

    Terex (TEX +8.1%) shoots up after the firm lands an upgrade from JPMorgan to Overweight from...

    Terex (TEX +8.1%) shoots up after the firm lands an upgrade from JPMorgan to Overweight from Neutral, helping shares jump back over $14 for the first time since early last month.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • TOT

    Closing its Ohio JV with Total (NYSE:TOT) just before 2011 ended gives Chesapeake Energy (CHK...

    Closing its Ohio JV with Total (NYSE:TOT) just before 2011 ended gives Chesapeake Energy (CHK +3.9%) nearly $2.5B in cash from three Q4 deals, and analysts “expect to see substantially all of the cash infusion be allocated to paying down" CHK's $3.2B balance in its revolving credit line. If it can reduce long-term debt to $10B or below, “it can assuage investors who remain wary of the company’s debt level.”
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM

  • Gold and silver erase the entirety of their late year dives in a few hours of 2012 trading, with...

    Gold and silver erase the entirety of their late year dives in a few hours of 2012 trading, with silver making a particularly dramatic move, +6.1% to $29.64/oz. Gold is 2.6% higher at $1,607. An effective hedge against stock declines earlier in 2011, gold and the S&P 500 have mostly risen and fallen together since the October equity lows.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM | 5 Comments
  • INTC

    Though most analysts seem inclined to look past the bad news in weak chip sales, Barclays now...

    Though most analysts seem inclined to look past the bad news in weak chip sales, Barclays now expects semiconductor revenue growth to come in flat to 4% in 2012, worse than its prior view for a 2%-5% rise. The firm lowers its ratings on INTC +0.8%, AMAT +0.9%, FSL +1.9%, MCHP -1.6% and CODE +0.8% to Equal Weight from Overweight.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) dives 7.4% to $19.10, below its IPO price of $20, after a survey of 400...

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) dives 7.4% to $19.10, below its IPO price of $20, after a survey of 400 merchants showed that 52% aren't planning to feature deals in the next six months. Another 24% only plan to carry one offer.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 2 Comments
  • MAKO

    Mako Surgical (MAKO +12.6%) rallies on heavy volume after analysts with Summer Street upgrade...

    Mako Surgical (MAKO +12.6%) rallies on heavy volume after analysts with Summer Street upgrade shares to Buy from Neutral on valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • MTN

    Shares of Vail Resorts (MTN -6.1%) lose ground after weather reports show an extended period of...

    Shares of Vail Resorts (MTN -6.1%) lose ground after weather reports show an extended period of light-to-no snow for the region. The ski resort in Vail reports only an 18-inch base of snow, with just 29% of its 1,521 acres open.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • WMT

    Netherland's largest pension fund, Algemeen Burgerlijk, or ABP, says it has divested of its...

    Netherland's largest pension fund, Algemeen Burgerlijk, or ABP, says it has divested of its stakes in Wal-Mart (WMT +1.2%) and PetroChina (PTR +5.4%) and blacklisted both companies because of their non-compliance with UN Global Compact principles. Neither company appears the worse for the move, with Wal-Mart even hitting a 52-week high.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • BHGE

    Baker Hughes (BHI +4%) moves higher after saying its new president and CEO, Martin Craighead,...

    Baker Hughes (BHI +4%) moves higher after saying its new president and CEO, Martin Craighead, has officially taken over the duties in his new role. Craighead replaces outgoing president and CEO, Chad Deaton, who remains on as chairman of the company's board of directors.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • BTU

    Shares of Peabody (BTU +9.2%) and Alpha Natural (ANR +8.1%) rally after a U.S. court ruled late...

    Shares of Peabody (BTU +9.2%) and Alpha Natural (ANR +8.1%) rally after a U.S. court ruled late Friday the EPA must delay implementing its Cross-State Air Pollution Rule. Brean Murray analysts say the ruling marks the "first positive event for domestic thermal coal producers in quite a while," although the threat of the air pollution rule "still looms later this year." PCX +7.4%, JRCC +7.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • AVEO

    Shares of Aveo Pharmaceuticals (AVEO -7.7%) trade lower after investors were left unsatisfied...

    Shares of Aveo Pharmaceuticals (AVEO -7.7%) trade lower after investors were left unsatisfied with the amount of data disclosed with the results of the firm's trial for tivozanib.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • BKNG

    Priceline.com (PCLN +3%) gains after announcing that Overstock.com (OSTK -1%) has selected the...

    Priceline.com (PCLN +3%) gains after announcing that Overstock.com (OSTK -1%) has selected the company to run its new travel website, called O.co Travel.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM | 2 Comments
  • CMG

    Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG +3.4%) is upgraded to Buy at Deutsche Bank as "the best growth story...

    Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG +3.4%) is upgraded to Buy at Deutsche Bank as "the best growth story in the restaurant industry given a 13% unit growth rate, industry-leading same store sales, industry-leading new unit returns, and a long runway for new stores." Deutsche expects even stronger earnings growth in 2012 than 2011 and higher share prices even after last year's 60% gain.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 3 Comments
  • WWW

    Shares of Wolverine (WWW -3.5%) slip this morning after Baird cut the shares to Neutral, citing...

    Shares of Wolverine (WWW -3.5%) slip this morning after Baird cut the shares to Neutral, citing difficult to match Q4 comps due to adverse weather, and adding that its valuation is less compelling than that of its peers.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • CYBX

    Cyberonics (CYBX +3.6%) trades up after the FDA approves AspireHC, one of its redesigned...

    Cyberonics (CYBX +3.6%) trades up after the FDA approves AspireHC, one of its redesigned epilepsy-treatment systems, allowing the medical-device maker to resume a limited commercial release of the product.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO +8.4%) soars amidst Morgan Stanely's Katy Huberty's upgrading the company to...

    Fusion-io (FIO +8.4%) soars amidst Morgan Stanely's Katy Huberty's upgrading the company to Overweight with a $30 target. She believes the enterprise flash market, of which Fusion-io is the leader, could nearly triple this year, and the recent lock-up expiration-induced pullback in the stock gives investors a tasty entry point.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • UAA

    Under Armour (UA +4%) gets a boost from a Baird upgrade to Outperform on valuation, saying the...

    Under Armour (UA +4%) gets a boost from a Baird upgrade to Outperform on valuation, saying the company should benefit from its strong product pipeline and overall momentum of the athletic apparel/footwear market.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • MO

    Altria (MO -2.8%) is among a small handful of S&P 500 stocks performing poorly today, stung...

    Altria (MO -2.8%) is among a small handful of S&P 500 stocks performing poorly today, stung by a Barron's article pointing out the company's key Marlboro brand is losing market share in an already declining market. That, combined with a lofty valuation for a "value" stock, may not be a great mix.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • VFC

    VF Corp. (VFC +3.1%) jumps after Citigroup upgrades the stock to Buy from Neutral, hikes...

    VF Corp. (VFC +3.1%) jumps after Citigroup upgrades the stock to Buy from Neutral, hikes the price target to $157 from $137 and adds it to the firm's "top picks live" list. Citi cites "strong brands" and "secular growth opportunities" within the company's outdoor segment, plus wider margins as cotton prices come down next year. XRT +1.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • RVBD

    Riverbed (NASDAQ:RVBD) +8.7% to $25.48 after Oppenheimer upgrades the stock to Outperform and...

    Riverbed (NASDAQ:RVBD) +8.7% to $25.48 after Oppenheimer upgrades the stock to Outperform and gives it a $30 price target, and increases its estimates for the current quarter. "Demand looks to be stronger than we expected across geographies, with a solid pipeline building," Oppenheimer writes.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • SIX

    Six Flags Entertainment (SIX +2.3%) says its board of directors has approved an expanded stock...

    Six Flags Entertainment (SIX +2.3%) says its board of directors has approved an expanded stock buyback that will allow the company to repurchase an additional $250M of its stock through 2015. The company just recently completed a three-year $60M program.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • CSCO

    Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) +4.3% to $18.79 after JP Morgan raises the stock to Overweight from Neutral...

    Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) +4.3% to $18.79 after JP Morgan raises the stock to Overweight from Neutral and its price target to $21 from $19. The bank explained that in 2011, Cisco suffered a "perfect storm of multiple small issues," but the situation has now changed. E.g., U.S. federal spending is forecast to rise in 2012 and "act as a tailwind."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • BAC

    U.S. banks (XLF +3.5%) shoot higher, responding to optimism about economic growth in emerging...

    U.S. banks (XLF +3.5%) shoot higher, responding to optimism about economic growth in emerging markets. The cost of insuring against the default of European sovereign debt was up this morning, but CDS protection actually fell for U.S. banks. At Bank of America (BAC +5.5%), CDS spreads fell to 397 bps vs. 404 a week ago and nearly 500 in November. Also: MS +6.2%, JPM +5%, C +7.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 2 Comments
  • MJN

    Mead Johnson (NYSE:MJN) +5.5% after regulators confirmed late Friday that the company's sealed...

    Mead Johnson (NYSE:MJN) +5.5% after regulators confirmed late Friday that the company's sealed cans of Enfamil baby formula were clear from a bacteria that was linked to the death of a 10-day-old baby. The death had prompted retailers to pull Enfamil from the shelves last month. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • CVC

    Shares of CableVision (CVC +4.4%) enjoy a boost after a Bloomberg article suggests the company...

    Shares of CableVision (CVC +4.4%) enjoy a boost after a Bloomberg article suggests the company as a potential takeover target for Time Warner Cable (TWC), Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA) or Charter (NASDAQ:CHTR). Even at a potential $23/share takeout, CVC would be valued at 7x EBITDA, "the industry’s lowest takeover multiple for a publicly traded target on record."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • TRIP

    TripAdvisor (TRIP +8.2%) tacks on a healthy gain after landing an upgrade from BofA to Buy from...

    TripAdvisor (TRIP +8.2%) tacks on a healthy gain after landing an upgrade from BofA to Buy from Underperform on valuation. Analysts expect the firm's Q4 report to improve transparency as it stands on its own after a spinoff from Expedia.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • BB

    Research in Motion (RIMM +3.7%) moves higher amidst a report of a corporate shake-up in which...

    Research in Motion (RIMM +3.7%) moves higher amidst a report of a corporate shake-up in which co-founders Mike Lazaridis and Jim Balsillie will give up their position as co-chairmen of the board. Barbara Stymiest, a board member since 2007 and former chief of the TSX Group, is rumored to be the leading replacement candidate.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • WBMD

    WebMD (WBMD +2.9%) shares continue to benefit from takeover rumors, the latest coming from a...

    WebMD (WBMD +2.9%) shares continue to benefit from takeover rumors, the latest coming from a weekend NY Post story discussing Japan's SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBY) as jumping into the auction for the medical information website. SoftBank owns a 30% stake in Alibaba and 35% of Yahoo Japan. Several PE firms reportedly submitted $2B-plus offers two weeks ago, but the bids were non-binding.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • CUTR

    Shares of Cutera (CUTR +4.4%) gain after the firm announces preliminary revenue for Q4 was...

    Shares of Cutera (CUTR +4.4%) gain after the firm announces preliminary revenue for Q4 was approximately $18M and the acquisition of assets of Iridex's global aesthetic business.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • ISIL

    Goldman Sachs slaps Sell ratings on Intersil (ISIL -0.2%) due to "structural challenges" and...
